comments.creator: fbertsch@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:
Two changes:
1. Set the top-level `os` field as a comma-separated `os_used_day`, to accommodate existing analyses
2. Change `services` to `service`. We can drop `services` altogether.
comments.author: fbertsch@mozilla.com
comments.text:
Two changes:
1. Set the top-level `os` field as a comma-separated `os_used_day`, to accommodate existing analyses
2. Change `services` to `service`. We can drop `services` altogether.

Confusion due to my slack message sorry -  I think we want to keep the singular `service` i.e. change `services` to `service` and drop `services`.  Also want to confirm with Alex that he is good with this.

comments.author: fbertsch@mozilla.com
comments.creator: fbertsch@mozilla.com

comments.text:
Good news and bad news.
Good news: I see the `os` property landed.
Bad news: It’s case sensitive so we now have `os` and the default value `OS` that we've been using up until now.

The second thing is that we seem to be stripping out the OS version so rather than Windows 7, Window Vista, etc… We just see Windows now in this `os` property.
comments.raw_text:
Good news and bad news.
Good news: I see the `os` property landed.
Bad news: It’s case sensitive so we now have `os` and the default value `OS` that we've been using up until now.

The second thing is that we seem to be stripping out the OS version so rather than Windows 7, Window Vista, etc… We just see Windows now in this `os` property.
comments.author: alex@alexdavis.ca
comments.creator: alex@alexdavis.ca

comments.text:
(In reply to Alex Davis [:adavis] [PM FxA] from comment #7)
It looks like we have capital OS now.

> The second thing is that we seem to be stripping out the OS version so rather than Windows 7, Window Vista, etc… We just see Windows now in this `os` property.

It looks like the old `OS` field was actually a concatenation of the  `os_name` and `os_version` fields from the server logs. If we wanted this back, I think we would need to change the import script to do this again. Frank, would this change break anything on your end?
